data.title: The Atari 2600 Master List
data.meta_description: Whew! I did it.......oh gosh, can't catch my breath...... It's been over 5 years since I started writing in this blog, mainly to play old video games and share my thoughts on them. It's evolved into so much more but playing video games, something I've been doing my whole life, has remained constant. What I…
data.text:
Whew! I did it…….oh gosh, can’t catch my breath……

It’s been over 5 years since I started writing in this blog, mainly to play old video games and share my thoughts on them. It’s evolved into so much more but playing video games, something I’ve been doing my whole life, has remained constant.

What I have here is my list, and keep that in mind, MY list of all Atari 2600 games ranked! Everyone loves a ranking right? Is it old now? Anyways, as you know, Atari’s original release record is a hot mess. Game codings were re-released as the same game, just recolored and re titled; third party came in and killed the system, tons of unreleased prototypes hit the market, etc. So, compiling an accurate list of everything that actually released on the system is damn near impossible so, I can’t promise this as accurate; but it’s the best I’ve got! Also, I’ve been playing and reviewing these for 5 years and inevitably, you rank games differently as time moves on, so again, MY LIST! It won’t be perfect, but I’m happy with it! Please, enjoy.

I ranked these games by 5 categories: Controls (how well the game plays, how it controls, camera, etc.), Graphics, Sound/Music effects, Replay Value and Originality.

(Sidenote: one of the greatest aspects of the Atari console was it’s cover art, so I’ve chosen to use those as the pics for my list!)

#1 Pitfall! (1982, Activision)

“The original adventure game- as unforgiving as it is addicting, Pitfall has always been, and remains my favorite 2600 title.”

#2 Yars’ Revenge(1982, Atari)

“A truly unique vision of game play and graphics- monster sound effects and visuals.”

#3 Berzerk (1980, Stern Electronics)

“A frightening gamescape to find yourself in; I still don’t know where I’m going or why; all I know is to keep shooting, moving and staying off the walls!”

#4 Frogger (1981, Konami)

“I still love playing this game; almost an existential screen capture of life itself- do I sound pretentious? I take this stuff seriously!”

#5 Jungle Hunt (1982, Taito)

“It’s like playing the fun action parts of an Indiana Jones movie; great controls.”

#6 Tapper (1983, Marvin Glass)

“A true test of your video game reflexes; keep ’em coming barkeep!”

#7 Laser Gates (1983, Imagic)

“The first truly great space shooter, in my book. Graphics and sound are amazing. “

#8 Star Raiders (1979, Doug Neubauer)

“Our first game glimpse of what it would feel like to occupy an X-wing starfighter; a personal favorite.”

#9 Plaque Attack (1983, Activision)

“Another personal favorite as a kid- wait a tic, hot dogs are bad for you? Did this make us want to brush our teeth more? No, just play more video games!”

#10 Centipede (1980, Dona Bailey & Ed Logg)

“There’s a reason this has been re-released on so many systems: challenging as hell, button mashy, video game greatness.”

#11 Dark Chambers (1983, Atari)

#12 Star Wars Jedi Arena (1983, Parker Brothers)

#13 Commando (1985, Activision)

#14 Bowling (1979, Atari)

#15 Moon Patrol (1982, Williams Entertainment Inc)
